editorialNotes.standard: Ancient Egyptians loved cats, Metallica hasn’t played the Super Bowl, and the Ganges is India’s largest river—all our useless knowledge is now coming in handy thanks to Trivia Crack. This bite-sized trivia game is totally irresistible, whether we’re dominating our Facebook friends in classic mode, trouncing strangers in the 12-question challenge mode, or just sneaking in a game on our Apple Watch. With its cute characters, heaps of unlockable achievements, and a massive variety of questions, we simply can’t get enough.

editorialNotes.short: Can you guess the name of this mountain or metropolis?

ios.subtitle: Out of the loop Most Likely To

editorialNotes.standard: The most ingenious thing about Blackbox's puzzles isn’t that you solve them without tapping or swiping. It’s that you’ll happily spend hours figuring out the game's subtle clues. Do you need to tilt your iPhone, shout into the speaker, or something a lot trickier? Thinking creatively and finding the answer feels deeply rewarding, even profound—earning Blackbox an Apple Design Award.

editorialNotes.standard: Collect caterpillars, grab coins atop a giant kitty, and decorate houses to attract new residents to your cozy forest hamlet.
Hamster wheels for exercise? Fishing ponds filled with capybaras? There’s so much cuteness packed into this idle resort game—we may never leave!

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.tagline: Make it a true Daily Double
Do you want to buy a vowel?
editorialNotes.standard:
What’s so fun about spinning that wheel? Our three favorite things:
1. Lightning-fast rounds make for the perfect quick-fix word game.
2. Playing friends head to head is irresistible. So is building puzzles for them to solve.
3. We never get tired of solving puzzles at the last second and winning bonus rounds.

editorialNotes.standard: Whether your groove is ’60s rock, Taylor Swift, or anything in between, this expertly crafted music-trivia game has all the tunes you’ll want to name. With clips from more than 10,000 songs, it’s easy to get hooked on its multiple-choice competitions, and the excellent new Party mode tests your skills against the masses in daily tournaments. Thankfully, if you played the first SongPop, your progress, coins, and so on carry over into this impressive sequel.
